summary: Odds storage must include both numerator and denominator (or decimal form) so 5/1 vs 5/2 are not conflated. Store computed implied probability with each race. Prediction output must include value edge (predictedProb – impliedProb) for betting decisions. Update bet sizing to factor in edge + variance, not just raw probability. Model weight updates should be driven by log-loss, not arbitrary Bayesian vibes. Add session window (e.g., last 50 races) for recency-weighted stats blended with lifetime stats. Store predicted probabilities per race for real calibration tracking. Ensure contender identity (name or number) is stored separately from lane/slot index. Cache computed contender stats on-device for fast load times.
architectural_notes: Use on-device persistent storage (e.g., AsyncStorage) for races/history and learned parameters.
Prediction algorithm should incorporate historical user-entered outcomes to adapt over time (simple incremental model acceptable).
Provide a one-tap reset that clears all persisted keys related to races/model state.
Odds should be stored/handled as fractional odds with fixed denominator 1; UI shows "-/1" placeholder when numerator is blank.
Finished product should not include an in-app download/APK instructions page/help section.
Track model calibration by comparing predicted probabilities vs outcomes; use this to adjust feature weights/trust factors over time (Bayesian-style updates acceptable).
Bet sizing guidance should derive from predicted probability vs odds and enforce: 1,000 minimum, 10,000 maximum, step size 1,000.
Remove/disable per-horse dynamic profiles and horse-level stat aggregation; do not maintain incremental per-horse histories.
Simplify race outcome logging to store only the top-3 finish order (1st/2nd/3rd).
Remove horse names from the saved race model and UI if they are not used by prediction.

existing_features.title: Make the app usable on Android via a mobile-first responsive web UI (touch-friendly controls, readable typography, and layouts that work well on small screens).
Add a structured data-entry flow that lets the user provide prediction inputs and outcomes (the data the user gives the app) in English-labeled forms, with basic validation and clear error messages.
Persist all user-provided data and learned prediction state on-device using durable browser storage, so app state survives reloads and long periods between sessions (long-term memory).
Implement prediction improvement over time by updating the prediction logic/model based on the user’s saved historical data (adaptive learning), and reflect the updated accuracy/metrics in the UI.
Add a clearly labeled "Reset App Memory" button that clears all on-device stored user data and learned prediction state after a confirmation prompt, returning the app to a fresh state.
Establish a coherent, distinctive visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) that is consistently applied across screens; avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
Add required generated static images to the app and render them in the UI where appropriate (e.g., app icon/branding areas) from frontend/public/assets/generated.
Replace the AppHeader subtitle text "AI-Powered Learning" with the exact new subtitle text: "AKA Big T's Glue Factory Contenders, AKA" Beebo Jr.".

Remove manual contender number entry and instead auto-populate exactly 6 contenders with fixed numbers "1", "2", "3", "4", "5", and "6" in the entry flow; the user should only input odds for each fixed contender, and the UI must not provide add/remove contender controls.

Update the prediction confidence UI to show a confidence bar that transitions from red at low confidence to green at high confidence, and display an emoji indicator that reflects how good/bad the confidence feels.

Rename the app everywhere it is user-visible from "Race Predictor" to the exact new name: "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" (including the header title text, the app icon alt text, and the HTML document title).

Update the race entry odds input UI to use fractional odds with a fixed denominator of "/1": each contender row must have a single numeric input for the numerator only, display a constant "/1" immediately next to it (not editable), and show "-/1" as the blank state.
Update all odds displays in the UI to render odds in the same fractional format "{numerator}/1" instead of showing a raw number (e.g., in History contender badges).

Add an in-app, English-language help section that explains how to get a usable Android APK from the deployed web app by wrapping the site URL in a WebView using a website-to-APK generator (include the steps and the example site mentioned in the conversation).
Remove the in-app Android APK (download instructions) page from the finished product by eliminating its navigation entry and preventing the help content from being reachable in the UI.

Update the "Overall Accuracy" meter in the Learning Status card to visually communicate accuracy using a red→green color transition based on the percentage value, and add an emoji indicator that reflects the meter’s "attitude" (worse at low accuracy, better at high accuracy).

Clarify in the Learning Status UI copy that predictions are intended to improve as more race outcomes are recorded (learning from saved history), without claiming guaranteed improvement for every individual user/dataset.

Deploy/publish the current application so it is live and accessible to users as a hosted Internet Computer web app, ensuring both the frontend assets and the backend canister (even if it has no business logic) compile and deploy successfully.

Extend the on-device race entry data model so each saved race logs per-horse identity and outcome details (at minimum: horse name, horse number, odds, finishing position/order, and margin), and capture these fields in the New Entry flow before saving.

Maintain an on-device, per-horse dynamic profile that updates incrementally after each saved race (do not overwrite history), and compute horse-level stats including Win %, Place %, Show %, recent form (last 5 finishes with margins), streak/slump indicators, and variance/consistency signals based on finish gaps.

Add betting performance tracking on-device, including overall prediction accuracy, ROI on recorded bets, per-strategy ROI breakdown, and confidence/probability calibration metrics comparing predicted probabilities vs. actual outcomes over time.

Enhance the prediction/learning algorithm to support weighted scoring with learnable feature weights (“trust factors”), update those weights after each race using a continuous feedback loop (Bayesian-style or similar incremental update), and output per-horse implied probabilities used for both confidence and bet sizing; include an ensemble-style combination of at least market odds and learned horse-profile signals.

Add bet sizing guidance based on predicted probability vs. odds, constrained to a minimum bet of 1,000, maximum bet of 10,000, in increments of 1,000, and present the suggested wager amount alongside the prediction output.

Add a new in-app Stats/Analytics view (accessible via the existing tab navigation) that surfaces (a) horse-level profiles and recent form, and (b) betting performance metrics including ROI and calibration summaries, using clear English labels optimized for mobile screens.

Remove the per-horse dynamic profile feature from on-device learned state, analytics UI, and prediction logic so the app no longer maintains or displays “horse profiles” or any per-horse recent-form/variance/streak stats.

Change race outcome recording to only capture the 1st-place, 2nd-place, and 3rd-place finish order (podium), and stop collecting/storing finish positions for 4th–6th and stop collecting/storing margin fields.
If horse names are not used by the prediction logic, remove horse name input, storage, and display across the app so entries are identified only by contender number and odds.
Update on-device storage schema/versioning to handle the removal of horse profiles, horse names, finish positions, and margins without breaking the app for existing users.
Update History and Stats calculations and UI text to reflect the simplified top-3 logging model (podium) while preserving existing betting performance metrics, ROI, and calibration where applicable.

Update the odds (fraction) numerator entry UI in the New Entry flow so each contender row uses a compact, smaller numeric input that visually looks like a small "0" box, with a non-editable "(/1)" displayed immediately to its right to represent the fractional format.

Extend the on-device race entry model to support horse-level performance tracking (Win/Place/Show rates and recent form), including storing per-race podium positions and optional podium margin fields so the app can compute last-5 recent form with positions and margins.

Update the New Entry flow UI to capture podium margins (for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd) using clear English labels, validate inputs, and save them with the race entry without changing the existing top-3 (podium) outcome workflow.

Reintroduce and compute horse-level (contender-number-level) stats on-device from saved history, including Win %, Place %, Show %, and Recent Form (last 5 races) using podium position plus any stored podium margins, and expose these computed stats in the Stats view.

Enhance the prediction strategy to use weighted scoring with learnable feature weights (“trust factors”), updating the weights after each saved race using a continuous feedback loop that compares implied probabilities vs actual outcomes, while still incorporating market odds as a core signal (ensemble-style combination of multiple signals).

Add streak/slump and variance/consistency signals based on saved history and (where available) recorded margins, and incorporate these signals into (a) confidence calculation and (b) Stats view summaries using clear English labels.
Update bet sizing guidance to support a minimum bet of 100 and a maximum bet of 10,000, and update the New Entry flow bet amount UI and validation to match these new constraints using English labels.

Update on-device storage schema/version handling so new learned-state fields (horse-level stats, streak/variance signals, and feature weights/trust factors) can be added without breaking existing users’ saved data, and recomputation continues to work after upgrades.
Update the New Entry odds numerator input so the example/placeholder shown in each horse odds field reads "0" until the user enters a value (replace the current example text like "e.g., 5.0").

Remove place/podium margin capture from the "Race Outcome" (race recording) step so users only select 1st/2nd/3rd and the app no longer validates, saves, or references margin inputs when recording a race outcome.

Extend emoji-based visual indicators beyond the existing prediction confidence display so that other key user-facing metrics also show an emoji that reflects their qualitative status (good/neutral/bad) using clear, consistent ranges and English labels. At minimum, add emoji indicators in the Stats view for: (a) Prediction Accuracy, (b) Overall ROI, and (c) Calibration Score (when shown). Reuse the existing emoji/range patterns where possible (e.g., the confidence emoji scale in EntryFlow and the accuracy emoji scale in accuracyVisuals) so the app’s “attitude” is consistent across screens.

Update the on-device race entry data model to store odds as either {numerator: number, denominator: number} or as a single decimal odds float value, replacing the current numerator-only storage so that 5/1 and 5/2 are correctly distinguished.

Compute and store implied probability for every race using the formula impliedProb = denominator / (numerator + denominator), and save it alongside the race entry data to enable consistent calibration calculations.

Update the race entry model to store contender identity (contender number or name) separately from lane/slot index (1-6) so that statistics track "which horse" performed well, not just "which slot" performed well.

Store the predicted probability and actual result (1 if win, 0 if not) for every contender in every race so that calibration can be accurately calculated by comparing predicted probabilities to actual outcomes over time.

Add a session window (e.g., last 50 races) to the learning model and compute statistics for both lifetime history and the recent window, then blend the two sets of stats using a configurable weighting to balance long-term trends with recent performance.

Replace the current Bayesian-style weight update mechanism with a concrete log-loss-based feedback loop: after each race, compute loss = -log(predictedProbOfWinner), then adjust feature weights to reduce this loss over time, making the model converge on accurate predictions.

Add value edge calculation to the prediction output using the formula edge = predictedProb - impliedProb, and display this edge value in the prediction UI so users can identify when a bet has positive expected value regardless of whether it is the most likely winner.

Update the bet sizing algorithm to factor in both value edge and confidence (variance): small edge or high variance suggests 1k-2k; decent edge with medium variance suggests 4k-6k; strong edge with low variance suggests 8k-10k, preventing the app from recommending large bets on uncertain predictions.

Add a new on-device storage key for cached computed contender stats (e.g., 'contenders') so that Win/Place/Show percentages, recent form, and other per-contender metrics are precomputed and stored, eliminating the need to recompute all stats from full history on every app open.

Add a Model Mood indicator to the prediction output UI that displays High, Medium, or Low confidence based on the model's recent calibration score and prediction accuracy over the last 15-20 races, using clear English labels and the existing emoji/color patterns for visual feedback.

Implement a Do Not Bet mode that evaluates whether any contender has a meaningful positive value edge (predictedProb significantly exceeding impliedProb), and if no contender meets the threshold, recommend Skip this race in the prediction output UI with clear messaging.

Add an Explain the Pick breakdown to the prediction output that shows per-signal contribution to the final confidence score (e.g., Odds Signal: +0.18, Recent Form: +0.11, History: +0.06, Consistency: -0.03) with the final confidence percentage, displayed in a clean, scannable format without walls of text.

Implement a Hot Streak Override in the prediction model that detects when a contender has finished in the podium (1st, 2nd, or 3rd) for 4 or more consecutive races, and temporarily increases that contender's predicted probability even if lifetime stats suggest otherwise, with the boost persisting until the streak is broken.

Add Strategy Profiles to the prediction flow that let users select between Safe Mode (higher hit rate, lower ROI), Value Mode (lower hit rate, higher ROI), Balanced, and Aggressive, where each mode applies different feature weight presets to the same underlying prediction model.

Implement RNG Tilt detection that monitors recent prediction performance and triggers a warning message (Pattern shift detected. Reducing bet size temporarily.) when the model starts missing predictions badly for multiple consecutive races, temporarily reducing suggested bet sizes until performance stabilizes.

Update the odds numerator input field in the New Entry flow so the placeholder text displays '0' (not '-/1' or any other text) when the field is empty, and position the non-editable '/1' label immediately to the right of the input field.

Create a new main info/dashboard page accessible via the existing tab navigation that displays key performance counters: total races run (count of saved race entries), prediction accuracy percentage (overall model accuracy from history), and ROI (return on investment from betting performance tracking).

Update the bet amount constraints in the New Entry flow to support a minimum bet of 0 (instead of 100) and a maximum bet of 10,000, and replace the fixed increment dropdown with a custom numeric input field that allows users to enter any value within the valid range.

Update the bet sizing algorithm logic to account for the new minimum bet constraint of 0, ensuring that when the model recommends 'Do Not Bet' or detects unfavorable conditions, it can suggest a bet amount of 0 instead of being forced to recommend at least 100.

Enhance the main info/dashboard page with additional useful user-friendly features that improve the overall app experience, such as: quick access to reset app memory, visual summary of strategy profile performance, recent race outcomes summary, or model mood/confidence trend indicators.

Update the streak tracking logic to differentiate between three streak types: Win Streak (1st place finishes only), Placer Streak (2nd or 3rd place finishes), and Lower Streak (4th-6th place finishes). Store and maintain these three separate streak counters per contender in the on-device learned state.

Incorporate all three streak types (Win Streak, Placer Streak, Lower Streak) as weighted signals in the prediction model alongside existing factors (market odds, recent form, history stats, consistency, hot streak override). Assign appropriate feature weights so positive streaks (Win, Placer) increase predicted probability while negative streaks (Lower) decrease it.

Update the Stats view to display all three streak types (Win Streak, Placer Streak, Lower Streak) for each contender alongside existing Win/Place/Show percentages and recent form, using clear English labels and visual indicators (emojis or color coding) to communicate streak strength.

Enhance the Hot Streak Override logic to apply only to Win Streaks (4+ consecutive 1st place finishes), not Placer Streaks or Lower Streaks, ensuring that the temporary probability boost is reserved for contenders with sustained winning performance.

Refine the log-loss feedback loop to increase feature weight adaptation rate when the model consistently misses predictions, and decrease adaptation rate when predictions are accurate, allowing the model to converge faster on optimal weights without overshooting.

Add odds movement detection that tracks changes in odds numerator values between consecutive races for the same contender, and use rising odds (decreasing confidence from the market) as a negative signal and falling odds (increasing market confidence) as a positive signal in the prediction model.

Implement contender momentum scoring that weights recent race outcomes more heavily than older outcomes (exponential decay), so a contender's recent 3-5 races contribute more to their predicted probability than races from 10+ races ago, improving responsiveness to form changes.

Add ensemble diversity scoring to the prediction output that shows how much the various signals (odds, streaks, form, consistency) agree or disagree on the top pick. When signals strongly agree, increase confidence; when signals diverge, reduce confidence and flag the prediction as uncertain in the UI.

Update the Explain the Pick breakdown to include the three new streak signal contributions (Win Streak: +X, Placer Streak: +Y, Lower Streak: -Z) alongside existing signals, ensuring the breakdown remains scannable and does not overwhelm users with too many metrics.
Update the odds numerator input field in the New Entry flow (EntryFlow.tsx) so the placeholder text displays '0' when the field is empty, replacing any existing placeholder text.
Position a non-editable '/1' label immediately to the right of each odds numerator input field in the New Entry flow to visually represent the fractional format with a fixed denominator of 1.
Revert the odds numerator input field placeholder text in EntryFlow.tsx from '0' back to its previous state (e.g., 'e.g., 5.0' or similar non-zero example text).
Remove the non-editable '/1' label positioned immediately to the right of each odds numerator input field in EntryFlow.tsx, restoring the previous odds input UI layout from version 17.
Update the odds numerator input field in EntryFlow.tsx so the placeholder text displays 'O' (capital letter O, not zero) when the field is empty, replacing any existing placeholder text.
Position a non-editable '/1' label immediately to the right of each odds numerator input field in EntryFlow.tsx to visually represent the fractional format with a fixed denominator of 1.

Create a new main dashboard info page accessible via the existing tab navigation that displays key performance counters: Total Races Run (count of saved race entries), Prediction Accuracy percentage (overall model accuracy from history), and ROI (return on investment from betting performance tracking).

Enhance the main dashboard info page with additional useful user-friendly features that improve the overall app experience, such as: quick access to reset app memory, visual summary of strategy profile performance, recent race outcomes summary, or model mood/confidence trend indicators.

Update the bet sizing algorithm logic in betSizing.ts to account for the new minimum bet constraint of 0, ensuring that when the model recommends 'Do Not Bet' or detects unfavorable conditions, it can suggest a bet amount of 0 instead of being forced to recommend at least 100.

Update the streak tracking logic in localMemoryStore.ts to differentiate between three streak types: Win Streak (1st place finishes only), Placer Streak (2nd or 3rd place finishes), and Lower Streak (4th-6th place finishes). Store and maintain these three separate streak counters per contender in the on-device learned state.

Incorporate all three streak types (Win Streak, Placer Streak, Lower Streak) as weighted signals in the prediction model (model.ts) alongside existing factors (market odds, recent form, history stats, consistency, hot streak override). Assign appropriate feature weights so positive streaks (Win, Placer) increase predicted probability while negative streaks (Lower) decrease it.

Update the Stats view (StatsAnalyticsView.tsx) to display all three streak types (Win Streak, Placer Streak, Lower Streak) for each contender alongside existing Win/Place/Show percentages and recent form, using clear English labels and visual indicators (emojis or color coding) to communicate streak strength.

Remove the Dashboard tab from the navigation in App.tsx, eliminating the tab UI element and its associated route so users cannot access DashboardView.tsx from the tab bar.
Update the Info tab in App.tsx to render InfoDashboardView.tsx instead of any other component, making it the primary dashboard/overview screen.
Preserve all existing functionality in New Entry, Stats, and History tabs without any modifications to their behavior, UI, or data flow.
Remove the Dashboard tab UI element and its associated route from the navigation bar in App.tsx so users cannot access DashboardView.tsx from the tab navigation.
